sum up.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to give the main information in a report, speech etc in a short statement at the end
sum up.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Gerald will open the debate and I will sum up.
To sum up, for a healthy heart you must take regular exercise and stop smoking.
In your final paragraph, sum up your argument.
sum up.translation[0].definitions[1].def: when a judge sums up or sums up the case at the end of a trial, he or she explains the main facts of the case
sum up.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to describe something using only a few words
sum up.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The city’s problem can be summed up in three words: too many people.
sum up.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to show the most typical qualities of someone or something
sum up.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: That image sums up the whole film.
sum up.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to form a judgment or opinion about someone or something
sum up.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Pat summed up the situation at a glance.
sum up.translation[0].definitions[5].def: used to say that a description of a situation is correct
sum up.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: ‘So you want us to help you change but you don’t believe change is possible?’ ‘That about sums it up.’
sum up.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to give the main information about a report, speech etc in a short statement
sum up.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The report is 260 pages long, but its message can be summed up in three words: “Keep standards high”.
To sum up, I suggest that if you are investing a sizeable amount for the first time, put it into two or three UK-based funds.
sum up.translation[1].definitions[1].def: when a judge sums up, he or she makes a statement at the end of a trial giving the main facts of the trial
sum up.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Summing up, the coroner praised the police for their investigation.
